You can create an SimpleMovingAverage indicator that does not automatically update. This lets you update the indicator with any data you choose. The following reference table describes the SimpleMovingAverage constructor.

Initializes a new instance of the SimpleMovingAverage class with the specified name and period.

Parameters
This constructor does not take any argument.

Return

SimpleMovingAverage - The new SimpleMovingAverage indicator object.

Definition at line 46 of file Indicators/SimpleMovingAverage.cs.

Initializes a new instance of the SimpleMovingAverage class with the default name and period.

Parameters
int period /

Return

SimpleMovingAverage - The new SimpleMovingAverage indicator object.

Definition at line 56 of file Indicators/SimpleMovingAverage.cs.


You can update the indicator automatically or manually.

Automatic Update

Create a consolidator and then call the RegisterIndicator method to update the indicator with the consolidated bars.

private SimpleMovingAverage _sma;

// In Initialize()
_sma = new SimpleMovingAverage(name, period);
_sma.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _sma, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_sma.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _sma.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.sma = SimpleMovingAverage(name, period)
self.sma.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.sma, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.sma.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.sma.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually enables you to control when the indicator is updated and what data you use to update it. To manually update the indicator, call the Update method that with time/decimal pair. The indicator will only be ready after you prime it with enough data.

private SimpleMovingAverage _sma;
private Symbol symbol;

// In Initialize()
_sma = new SimpleMovingAverage(name, period);
symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;

// In OnData()
if (data.ContainsKey(_symbol))
{
    _sma.Update(data[symbol].EndTime, data[symbol].High);
}
if (_sma.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _sma.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.sma = SimpleMovingAverage(name, period)
self.symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol

# In OnData()
if data.ContainsKey(self.symbol):
    self.sma.Update(data[self.symbol].EndTime, data[self.symbol].High)
if self.sma.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.sma.Current.Value
